data.name: email_threshold
data.info: Email indicators with confidence value above this threshold are considered malicious.

data.name: include_inactive
data.info: Whether to include inactive indicators in reputation commands.

data.display: Default DBOT score for indicators with low confidence
data.name: indicator_default_score
remote_api
data.info: Gather additional information about the threat model from remote APIs.

data.name: create_relationships
data.info: Create relationships between indicators as part of enrichment.

data.name: integrationReliability
data.info: Reliability of the source providing the intelligence data.

data.display: Mail server hostname or IP address
data.name: MailServerURL
first_fetch
data.info: First insight updated date to fetch. e.g., "24 hours", "7 days", "1 month"

data.name: min_probability
data.info: Filter out NDR insights with probability lower than this value

data.display: Maximum number of incidents per fetch
data.name: max_fetch

integration_instances.name: Core REST API - Standard XSIAM API Key Cred

data.name: url
data.info: For Cortex or Cortex XSIAM, use the Copy API URL button on the API Keys page. For Cortex, use the server URL.

data.name: use_tenant
data.info: Whether API calls should be made to the current tenant instead of the main tenant.

data.name: auth_method
data.info: Whether authentication should be using "Standard" API key or "Advanced" API key. For XSOAR version < 8.0.0, choose "Standard".

data.name: creds_apikey
data.info: Please provide API Key ID when using Cortex XSIAM or Cortex and above.

data.name: url
data.info: The web UI with `api-` appended to front (e.g., https://api-xsiam.paloaltonetworks.com). For more information please see https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/cortex/cortex-xdr/cortex-xdr-api/cortex-xdr-api-overview/get-started-with-cortex-xdr-apis.

data.name: credentials
data.info: For more information please see https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/cortex/cortex-xdr/cortex-xdr-api/cortex-xdr-api-overview/get-started-with-cortex-xdr-apis.  Only standard API key type is supported.

data.name: timeout
data.info: The timeout of the HTTP requests sent to Cortex API (in seconds).

data.display: Close Mirrored CrowdStrike Falcon Incident or Detection
data.name: close_in_cs_falcon
data.info: When selected, closing the Cortex incident is mirrored in CrowdStrike Falcon, according to the types that were chosen to be fetched and mirrored.

data.name: legacy_version
data.info: Use the legacy version of the API, which refers to versions prior to the 'Next Generation Raptor release.'

data.name: ofp_detection_fetch_query
data.info: Use the Falcon Query Language. For more information, refer to the FQL syntax documentation: https://www.falconpy.io/Usage/Falcon-Query-Language.html

data.display: Detections from On-Demand Scans fetch query
data.name: on_demand_fetch_query
data.info: Use the Falcon Query Language. For more information, refer to the FQL syntax documentation: https://www.falconpy.io/Usage/Falcon-Query-Language.html

data.name: close_incident
data.info: When selected, closing the CrowdStrike Falcon incident is mirrored in Cortex.

data.display: First fetch timestamp (<number> <time unit>, e.g., 12 hours, 7 days)
data.name: fetch_time
iom_fetch_query
data.info: Use the Falcon Query Language. For more information, refer to the FQL syntax documentation: https://www.falconpy.io/Usage/Falcon-Query-Language.html

data.name: idp_detections_fetch_query
data.info: Use the Falcon Query Language. For more information, refer to the FQL syntax documentation: https://www.falconpy.io/Usage/Falcon-Query-Language.html

data.name: incidents_per_fetch
data.info: Input a value between 1-500.

data.name: Reliability
data.info: Reliability of the source providing the intelligence data. Currently used for “CVE” reputation  command.

data.name: mobile_detections_fetch_query
data.info: Use the Falcon Query Language. For more information, refer to the FQL syntax documentation: https://www.falconpy.io/Usage/Falcon-Query-Language.html

data.name: fetch_incidents_or_detections
data.info:
Choose what to fetch -  You can choose any combination. Notes: 1. The 'On-Demand Scans Detection' option is not available in the legacy version.
2. Records from the detection endpoint of the CrowdStrike Falcon UI could be of types: 'Endpoint Detection' and 'OFP Detection'.

data.name: incidents_fetch_query
data.info: Use the Falcon Query Language. For more information, refer to the FQL syntax documentation: https://www.falconpy.io/Usage/Falcon-Query-Language.html

data.name: reopen_statuses
data.info: CrowdStrike Falcon statuses that will reopen an incident in Cortex if closed. You can choose any combination.

data.name: fetch_query
data.info: Use the Falcon Query Language. For more information, refer to the FQL syntax documentation: https://www.falconpy.io/Usage/Falcon-Query-Language.html

data.display: Advanced: Time in minutes to look back when fetching incidents and detections
data.name: look_back
data.info: Use this parameter to determine the look-back period for searching for incidents that were created before the last run time and did not match the query when they were created.

data.name: mirror_direction
data.info: Choose the direction to mirror the detection: Incoming (from CrowdStrike Falcon to Cortex), Outgoing (from Cortex to CrowdStrike Falcon), or Incoming and Outgoing (to/from CrowdStrike Falcon and Cortex).

data.name: ioa_fetch_query
data.info: In the query parameter format: 'cloud_provider=aws&aws_account_id=1234'. The query must specify a 'cloud_provider'. Multiple values for the same parameter is not supported. For more information, refer to documentation on CSPM Registration Keyword Arguments: https://www.falconpy.io/Service-Collections/CSPM-Registration.html#keyword-arguments-13

data.display: Max number of events per fetch
data.name: max_events_per_fetch
feedBypassExclusionList
data.info: When selected, the exclusion list is ignored for indicators from this feed. This means that if an indicator from this feed is on the exclusion list, the indicator might still be added to the system.

data.name: feedReliability
data.info: Reliability of the source providing the intelligence data.

data.name: feedTags
data.info: Supports CSV values.

data.display: Save intrusion sets as threat actor indicator types
data.name: switch_intrusion_set_to_threat_actor
tlp_color
data.info: The Traffic Light Protocol (TLP) designation to apply to indicators fetched from the feed.

data.name: feedReputation
data.info: Indicators from this integration instance will be marked with this reputation.

data.name: tenant_id
data.info: See the Help tab.

data.name: use_managed_identities
data.info: Relevant only if the integration is running on Azure VM. If selected, authenticates based on the value provided for the Azure Managed Identities Client ID field. If no value is provided for the Azure Managed Identities Client ID field, authenticates based on the System Assigned Managed Identity. For additional information, see the Help tab.

data.display: Fetch incidents of the given service sources only.
data.name: fetch_service_sources
data.info: Relevant only for Alerts v2. Multiple serviceSource can be inserted separated by a comma, for example "microsoftDefenderForEndpoint,microsoftDefenderForIdentity",. If empty, incidents of all providers will be fetched.

data.display: MS graph security alert API Version
data.name: api_version
managed_identities_client_id
data.info: The Managed Identities client ID for authentication - relevant only if the integration is running on Azure VM.

data.name: private_key
data.info: Used for certificate authentication. The private key of the registered certificate.

data.name: self_deployed
data.info: Select this checkbox if you are using a self-deployed Azure application.

data.name: auth_code
data.info: Get the authorization code from steps 3-5 in the self deployed authorization process.

data.name: enc_key
data.info: See the Help tab.

data.name: certificate_thumbprint
data.info: Used for certificate authentication as it appears in the "Certificates & secrets" page of the app.

data.name: microsoft_365_defender_context
data.info: Save Hunting Query result to the Microsoft 365 Defender context path.

data.name: fetch_filter
data.info: Use this field to filter fetched incidents according to any of the alert properties. Overrides the providers list, if given. Filter should be in the format "{property} eq '{property-value}'". Multiple filters can be applied separated with " and ", for example "createdDateTime eq YYYY-MM-DD and severity eq 'high'".

data.display: Fetch incidents of the given providers only.
data.name: fetch_providers
data.info: Relevant only for Legacy Alerts. Multiple providers can be inserted separated by a comma, for example "{first_provider},{second_provider}". If empty, incidents of all providers will be fetched.

data.display: First fetch timestamp (<number> <time unit>, e.g., 12 hours, 7 days)
data.name: fetch_time
data.info: <number> <time unit>, for example 1 hour, 30 minutes

data.name: auth_id
data.info: See the Help tab.

data.name: webhookurl
data.info: The webhook URL in the Teams channel.

data.name: feedBypassExclusionList
data.info: When selected, the exclusion list is ignored for indicators from this feed. This means that if an indicator from this feed is on the exclusion list, the indicator might still be added to the system.

data.name: tlp_color
data.info: The Traffic Light Protocol (TLP) designation to apply to indicators fetched from the feed

data.name: feedTags

data.name: allow_germany
data.info: In some cases, the Germany endpoints can be unavailable for some users. By default, we exclude Germany to prevent the fetch indicators from failing.

data.info: A string specifying which threat statuses to return. If empty, will return "active" and "cleared" threats. Can be "active", "cleared", or "falsePositive".

data.name: feedBypassExclusionList
data.info: When selected, the exclusion list is ignored for indicators from this feed. This means that if an indicator from this feed is on the exclusion list, the indicator might still be added to the system.

data.name: feedIncremental
data.info: Incremental feeds pull only new or modified indicators that have been sent from the integration. As the determination if the indicator is new or modified happens on the 3rd-party vendor's side, and only indicators that are new or modified are sent to Cortex, all indicators coming from these feeds are labeled new or modified.

data.name: feedReliability
data.info: Reliability of the source providing the intelligence data.

data.name: rate_limit_retry_count
data.info: The number of times to try when getting a Rate Limit response.

data.name: rate_limit_wait_seconds
data.info: The number of seconds to wait each iteration when getting a Rate Limit response.

data.name: with_error
data.info: If set, failed command results will be returned as warnings instead of errors.

data.name: integrationReliability
data.info: Reliability of the source providing the intelligence data.

data.name: old-version
data.info: Get the Legacy output of context data for 'whois' and 'domain' commands.

data.name: proxy
data.info: Effect the `ip` command and the other commands only if the Proxy URL is not set.

data.name: proxy_url
data.info: Supports socks4/socks5/http connect proxies (e.g. socks5h://host:1080). Will effect all commands except for the `ip` command.

data.name: rate_limit_errors_suppressed
data.info: Whether Rate Limit errors should be supressed or not.
